name: Canva modules
title: Canva modules

children.text: After connecting to the Canva app, you can use the following modules to build your
Retrieves details about an existing image.

data.label: Canva
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Canva account.

children.text: Select or map the folder that contains an image you want to get.
Select or map an image you want to get.
Uploads an image to a user's library. When specifying an image that already exists, it's renamed.

data.label: Canva
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Canva account.

children.text: Enter the name of a new image.
Enter the data of a new image. Canva supports the following formats:
JPEG, PNG, HEIC, Single-frame GIFs, TIFF, WEBP
Add or map a tag for a new image.
Updates the metadata for an image.

data.label: Canva
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Canva account.

children.text: Select or map the folder that contains an image you want to update.
Select or map an image you want to update.
Enter the new name for an image.
Add or map a tag for an image.
Deletes an Image. It doesn't remove an image from designs that already use it.

data.label: Canva
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Canva account.

children.text: Select or map the folder that contains an image you want to delete.
Select or map an image you want to delete.
plan to use the brand templates API. You can use these modules only if your user account is on a
Searches for specific brand templates or returns all brand templates.

data.label: Canva
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Canva account.

children.text: Enter a search term or multiple terms to filter brand templates by name, keywords, or text content.
Select how to sort the returned brand templates:
Select how to filter brand templates based on ownership:
Leave empty to return all brand templates available to the user.
Select how to filter brand templates based on dataset definitions:
Leave empty to return all brand templates regardless of dataset assignment.
Enter the maximum number of results to return per execution cycle.
Retrieves detailed information about a brand template.

data.label: Canva
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Canva account.

children.text: Select the brand template you want to retrieve information about.
Select whether to include the dataset definition in the returned brand template.
Autofill a Design from a Brand Template
Autofills a design from a brand template with input information.

data.label: Canva
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Canva account.

children.text: Select the autofill method you want to use:
Enter the title of the new design.
Select the brand template you want to use for autofill. If you select
as the method, enter the brand template ID.

data.label: Canva
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Canva account.

children.text: Select or map the folder that contains an image you want to insert into a new design.
Select or map an image you want to insert into a new design.
Enter the name of a new design.
Enter the width of a new design in pixels.
Enter the height of a new design in pixels.

data.label: Canva
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Canva account.

children.text: Enter the name of a design you want to import.
Enter the data of a new design.
to know more about importing a design.
Exports a design in a chosen format.

data.label: Canva
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Canva account.

children.text: Select or map the folder that contains a design you want to export.
Select or map a design you want to export.
Select or map the format in which you want to export a design.
: Select or map the size of pages.
: Specify the quality level. The higher the number is, the better quality is.
: Specify if you want the design to be compressed with a lossless compression algorithm.
: Specify if you want to merge all pages of the design. The design will be exported as a whole page.
: Enter the height of a new design in pixels.
: Enter the width of a new design in pixels.
: Select the orientation and quality of the exported video.
Specify pages you want to export. Separate pages with a comma or define a range with a hyphen.

data.label: Canva
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Canva account.

children.text: Select or map the folder that contains items you want to list.
Select or map item types you want to list.
Set the maximum number of items Make will return during one execution cycle.
Retrieves details about an existing folder.

data.label: Canva
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Canva account.

children.text: Select or map the ID of a folder you want to get.

data.label: Canva
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Canva account.

children.text: Select or map the folder where you want to add a new folder.
Enter the name of a new folder.
Moves items from one folder to another.

data.label: Canva
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Canva account.

children.text: Select or map the folder that contains an item you want to move.
Select or map an item you want to move.
Select or map the destination folder where you want to move an item to.

data.label: Canva
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Canva account.

children.text: Select or map the folder that you want to update.
Enter a new name of the folder.

data.label: Canva
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Canva account.

children.text: Select or map the ID of the folder you want to delete.
Creates a new top-level comment on a design.
Select or map the folder that contains a design you want to comment.
Select or map a design you want to comment.
Enter a text of your comment. You can mention a user or a team by specifying a
Replies to a top-level comment on a design.

data.label: Canva
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Canva account.

children.text: Select or map the folder that contains a design whose comment you want to reply to.
Select or map a design whose comment you want to reply to.
Enter the ID of the comment you want to reply to.
Enter a text of your comment. You can mention a user or a team by specifying a
Performs an arbitrary authorized API call.

data.label: Canva
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Canva account.

children.text: Select or map the HTTP method you want to use:
to retrieve information for an entry.
Enter the desired request headers. You don't have to add authorization headers; we already did that for you.
Enter the body content for your API call.

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
